item.title: NASA Awards Liquid Hydrogen Supply Contracts - NASA
item.description: NASA has selected Plug Power, Inc., of Slingerlands, New York, and Air Products and Chemicals, Inc., of Allentown, Pennsylvania, to supply up to approximately

item.title: NASA’s Scott Tingle to Serve as Agency’s Chief Astronaut - NASA
item.description: NASA named astronaut Scott Tingle as chief of the Astronaut Office at the agency’s Johnson Space Center in Houston, effective Nov. 10. A decorated spaceflight

item.title: 2025 News Releases - NASA
item.description: Sign up to receive NASA news releases and other information.

item.title: Week Wraps with Fluid Physics, Stem Cell Research as New Crew Preps Begin - NASA
item.description: Expedition 73 wrapped up the work week continuing to study fluid physics and stem cells, preparing for next week’s new crew arrival, and unpacking a U.S. cargo spacecraft. The International Space Station residents also serviced exercise gear, performed life support system troubleshooting, and analyzed the orbital outpost’s microbial environment.

item.title: Crew Works on Stem Cells, CubeSats; Prepares for Soyuz and Commercial Crew Launches - NASA
item.description: Stem cells and CubeSat installations were the main research focus aboard the International Space Station on Thursday. The Expedition 73 crew also collected microbe samples for analysis, configured Earth observation gear, and replaced hoses on a treadmill.

item.title: NASA, Aerospace Corporation Study Sharpens Focus on Ammonia Emissions
item.description: The pungent gas contributes to fine airborne particulate pollution, which endangers human health when inhaled and absorbed in the bloodstream.

item.title: NASA’s Mars Spacecraft Capture Images of Comet 3I/ATLAS
item.description: Two orbiters and a rover captured images of the interstellar object — from the closest location any of the agency’s spacecraft may get — that could reveal new details.

item.title: NASA Cassini Study Finds Organics ‘Fresh’ From Ocean of Enceladus
item.description: Researchers dove deep into information gathered from the ice grains that were collected during a close and super-fast flyby through a plume of Saturn’s icy moon.

item.title: NASA, SpaceX Launch US-European Satellite to Monitor Earth’s Oceans
item.description: Sentinel-6B will extend a decades-long legacy of global sea level measurements that help forecast weather, protect coastal communities, and more.

item.title: NASA, European Partners Set to Launch Sentinel-6B Earth Satellite
item.description: Set to track sea levels across more than 90% of Earth’s ocean, the mission must first get into orbit. Here’s what to expect.

item.title: 6 Things to Know From NASA About New US, European Sea Satellite
item.description: Data from Sentinel-6B will continue a decades-long record of sea surface height, helping to improve coastal planning, protect critical infrastructure, and advance weather forecasts.

item.title: NASA Sets Launch Coverage for International Ocean Tracking Mission
item.description: The agency is preparing to launch Sentinel-6B, an international satellite that will measure sea surface height for 90% of the planet’s ocean.

item.title: JPL Workforce Update
item.description: A message from JPL Director Dave Gallagher

item.title: NASA-ISRO Satellite Lifts Off to Track Earth’s Changing Surfaces
item.description: The first-of-its kind satellite will provide actionable information in a range of areas, including disaster response, infrastructure monitoring, and agricultural management.
